page.title: 17The Franciscan Friary
page.content: The Friary was originally built in 1837 by Dunn and Hanson, although never completed to the original design. The main structure comprises two three storey wings of brick with stone dressings to the doors and windows. The friary is attached to the church which was built between 1926 and 1929. At the moment there are 11 people living in the friary, five of them training to be priests but they no longer belong to the Franciscan Order. The living quarters are much bigger than you would think looking from outside.The people living there are very friendly and think of others outside the walls. They have a large room with a table for feeding tramps who knock on the door.
